VDG_EN_cover9_Layout 1 16-Mar-16 2:39 PM Page 1
Mina Ricci
Via della Grammatica
for English speakers Mina Ricci Theory, exercises, tests and authentic material for foreigners
Via della Grammatica
for English speakers
Theory, exercises, tests and authentic material for foreigners Via della Grammatica for English speakers is a practical and straightforward introduction to all the essential grammar points of Italian in a single volume. It is designed for beginner to intermediate level students (A1-B2 Common European Framework of Reference for Languages).
Via della Grammatica for English speakers comprises: for English speakers
• 40 units, each one dealing with one or more areas of grammar using clear and simple language • A revision test every 5 units enabling students to check their progress independently • Grammar points provided in clear and concise tables, which explain standard and practical use of grammar rules • A wide range of exercises, tests, stimulating and entertaining activities, enabling students to practise the grammar rules they have learned • Terminology introduced gradually that reflects current everyday Italian; in some cases new semantic groups are presented with images to facilitate learning • Authentic materials on a range of cultural, literary and everyday themes providing students with the opportunity to enrich and widen their knowledge of Italian society, history and civilisation • A contemporary and attractive format with many photographs Via della Grammatica Via della Grammatica • Keys to the exercises making this grammar book very useful for independent learners • A glossary is available on www.edilingua.it
Via della Grammatica for English speakers is completed by i-d-e-e, a platform that includes the exercises in interactive form and extra material and digital tools for both students and teachers.
Via della Grammatica for English speakers is an essential tool for teachers. It can be used as a text book with an Italian language course, or as a means of study and evaluation for those who wish to learn and practise the language on their own.
You can download for free the multilingual Glossary from our website. La Terra ha bisogno di aiuto... del tuo aiuto! ISBN 978-960-693-050-8 Edilingua supports
Edili ng ua p er l’am biente www.edilingua.it
Via della Grammatica for English speakers This volume without the side coupon is to be considered “sample copy” not for sale.

VDG_prime e indice_EN167_1. I nomi in o a e 16-Mar-16 12:00 PM Page 2
Mina Ricci obtained a first degree in Foreign Languages and Literatures from the University of Mo dern Languages in Milan (IULM), followed by a Masters in Translation at the University of West - min ster in London. She has taught Italian in various companies and institutions, such as the Italian Cul tural Institute in Dublin and the Applied Languages Centre at University College Dublin. She has also taught Italian language and culture for several years in the Department of Italian in the School of Languages and Literatures at University College Dublin.
To my dear father Paolo Maria Ricci

VDG_prime e indice_EN:1. I nomi in o a e 15/4/2011 5:10 ìì Page 3
PREFACE
Via della Grammatica is suitable for young adults and adults at beginner-intermediate level (A1- B2 Common European Framework of Reference for Languages) and for LS/L2 Italian language courses. This text is a practical and straightforward grammar book consisting of 40 Units, each of which deals with one or more areas of grammar. In each Unit grammar is presented using clear and con- cise tables, which provide standard and practical use of the rules, rather than theoretical analysis. The grammar points are accompanied by a wide range of stimulating and enjoyable activities, enabling students to learn empirically and to practise using Italian grammar rules. Information about aspects of everyday life, culture and, in some cases, literature – introduced through many exercises and activities – encourages students to enrich and widen their knowledge of Italian soci- ety, history and civilisation. This information is often in the form of authentic materials, including articles from the press, literature, publicity and songs.
Lexis is introduced gradually, and reflects the use of current everyday language. To make the activities more interesting, new semantic groups are sometimes presented with an image to aid learning.
At the end of every 5 Units, a set of exercises tests the grammar taught in those Units. The 8 tests are complete with self-assessment tools, which provide plenty of opportunity for independent learning.
Via della Grammatica can be used as a teaching tool for learning and checking grammar in a vari- ety of Italian courses. Assisted by the keys to the tests, the book is ideal for self-study. For this reason, it can be used independently or combined with a course book for teaching Italian to for- eigners.
The Author

VDG_prime e indice_EN:1. I nomi in o a e 15/4/2011 5:11 ìì Page 6

1. I nomi in -o -a -e_EN:1. I nomi in o a e 15/4/2011 5:12 ìì Page 7
Nouns ending in -o and -a
SINGULAR PLURAL masculine feminine masculine feminine o a i e
ragazzo ragazzi Nouns ending in -o are usually masculine quaderno quaderni The plural of nouns ending in -o is -i. bambino bambini
ragazza ragazze Nouns ending in -a are usually feminine penna penne The plural of nouns ending in -a is -e. chiesa chiese
Nouns ending in -e
SINGULAR PLURAL
masculine feminine masculine feminine e e i i
Nouns ending in -e are may be masculine (m) giornale giornali or feminine. (f) chiave chiavi The plural of nouns ending in -e is -i.
attore attori Nouns ending in -tore, -ale, -ile are usually canale canali masculine. fucile fucili
attrice attrici Nouns ending in -trice are usually feminine. lezione lezioni Nouns ending in -zione are always feminine. stazione stazioni
EXERCISES
1.1 Find these 9 nouns in the grid then say whether they are masculine or feminine, as in the example. 01. I nomi penna canale tavolo libro porta finestra attore lezione mamma
Via della Grammatica 7

lettera (f) regal_ cappell_ scultric_ music_ stanz_ ciel_ luc_ pittor_ mar_ nazion_ cas_ 8 edizioni Edilingua

2. I nomi plurale irregolare_EN:2. I nomi plurale irregolare 15/4/2011 5:13 ìì Page 11
Nouns with unusual plurals
Noun group ending in -a
Some nouns ending in -a are masculine and poeta (m) poeti form the plural with -i problema (m) problemi programma (m) programmi
Careful! cinema (m) cinema
Nouns ending in -ista are can be masculine farmacista (m) farmacisti or feminine. The singular is always -ista farmacista (f) farmaciste while the plural form changes. giornalista (m) giornalisti giornalista (f) giornaliste
The plural of nouns ending in -cia and -gia camicia (f) camicie is -cie and -gie if the group is preceded by a valigia (f) valigie vowel. doccia (f) docce The plural of nouns ending in -cia and -gia arancia (f) arance is -ce and -ge if the group is preceded by a pioggia (f) piogge consonant. spiaggia (f) spiagge
Careful! When the -i in -cia and -gia is stressed the farmacia (f) farmacie plural is always -cie and -gie bugia (f) bugie allergia (f) allergie
The plural of masculine nouns ending in -ca duca (m) duchi and -ga is -chi and -ghi. collega (m) colleghi The plural of feminine nouns ending in -ca amica (f) amiche and -ga is -che and -ghe. collega (f) colleghe
Noun group ending in -o
The plural of nouns of two syllables ending fuoco (m) fuochi 02. Nomi particolari in -co and -go is -chi and -ghi. luogo (m) luoghi cuoco (m) cuochi
Careful!
The plural of nouns of more than two sylla- tedesco (m) tedeschi bles ending in -co and -go is -chi and -ghi if albergo (m) alberghi -co and -go are preceded by a consonant.
Via della Grammatica 11

2. I nomi plurale irregolare_EN:2. I nomi plurale irregolare 15/4/2011 5:13 ìì Page 12
02. Nomi particolari
But the plural of nouns of more than two nemico (m) nemici syllables ending in -co and -go is -ci and -gi asparago (m) asparagi if -co and -go are preceded by a vowel. medico (m) medici
Important! Careful!
As you can see, there are many exceptions carico (m) carichi to this rule. If in doubt, look up the noun in obbligo (m) obblighi your dictionary.
The plural of nouns ending in -logo is -logi if psicologo (m) psicologi they refer to people. radiologo (m) radiologi
The plural of other nouns ending in -logo is catalogo (m) cataloghi -loghi if they refer to things. dialogo (m) dialoghi
The plural of masculine nouns ending in -io figlio (m) figli is -i, but when the -i is stressed the plural is occhio (m) occhi -ii. bacio (m) baci zio (m) zii
Invariable nouns
Nouns ending in -à, -è and -ù have the sa - città (f) città me singular and plural form. università (f) università caffè (m) caffè tè (m) tè gioventù (f) gioventù tribù (f) tribù menù (m) menù ragù (m) ragù
Some nouns ending in -o have the same sin- video (m) video gular and plural form. These are often abbre- stereo (m) stereo viations. moto(cicletta) (f) moto auto(mobile) (f) auto radio(fonia) (f) radio foto(grafia) (f) foto frigo(rifero) (m) frigo
Many nouns ending in -ie are feminine and serie (f) serie have the same singular and plural form. specie (f) specie
Careful!
moglie (f) mogli
12 edizioni Edilingua

2. I nomi plurale irregolare_EN:2. I nomi plurale irregolare 15/4/2011 5:14 ìì Page 13
Masculine and feminine nouns of foreign ori- autobus (m) autobus gin are the same in the singular and plural. film (m) film file (m) file brioche (f) brioche toilette (f) toilette e-mail (f) e-mail
Nouns ending in -i are often feminine and ha - metropoli (f) metropoli ve the same singular and plural form. tesi (f) tesi crisi (f) crisi
Nouns with irregular plural forms
Some nouns are masculine singular (-o) and uovo (m) uova (f) feminine plural (-a). lenzuolo (m) lenzuola (f) This group includes nouns indicating parts dito (m) dita (f) of the body. braccio (m) braccia (f) ginocchio (m) ginocchia (f)
Careful!
mano (f) mani (f)
Some unusual nouns have a plural that is uomo (m) uomini quite different to the singular. dio (m) dei bue (m) buoi
Il Duomo, Milano
EXERCISES
2.1 Tick the correct box.
SINGULAR PLURAL 11. armadio 12. colleghe 13. ginocchio
14. pacco 15. operai 16. alberghi 17. programma 18. giornaliste 02. Nomi particolari 19. pioggia 10. psicologi
Via della Grammatica 13

2. I nomi plurale irregolare_EN127_2. I nomi plurale irregolare 12-Jun-15 11:29 AM Page 14
02. Nomi particolari
2.2 Choose the correct plural.
1. problema a. n problemi 6. città a. n città b. n probleme b. n cittè c. n problemo c. n cittì
2. negozio a. n negozie 7. spiaggia a. n spiaggie b. n negozia b. n spiaggio c. n negozi c. n spiagge
3. luogo a. n luoghe 8. auto a. n auto b. n luoghi b. n auti c. n luoghu c. n aute
4. mano a. n mane 9. cuoco a. n cuoche b. n mani b. n cuochi c. n manu c. n cuochu
5. camping a. n camping 10. barca a. n barce b. n campings b. n barchi c. n campingi c. n barche
2.3 Make words, as in the example.
che ce gne che le chi gie che ce gne che le chi gie 1. Cilie ............. 3. Albicoc ............. 5. Me ...........
Pes che ............. 2. Fi ............. 4. Pru ............. 6. Aran ..........
2.4 Put the nouns in the plural.
Gianni vive da poco in una nuova zona di Roma. È molto con- tento perché è una zona bella e tranquilla con molto verde. Ci sono, infatti, due (1. ).............................. Poi ci so no (2. )............................., (3. )............................., (4. )............................. e due (5. ).............................. Ci so no anche due (6. )............................. vicino a casa sua, che possono sempre essere utili.
14 edizioni Edilingua

Via della Grammatica for English speakers comprises: for English speakers
• 40 units, each one dealing with one or more areas of grammar using clear and simple language • A revision test every 5 units enabling students to check their progress independently • Grammar points provided in clear and concise tables, which explain standard and practical use of grammar rules • A wide range of exercises, tests, stimulating and entertaining activities, enabling students to practise the grammar rules they have learned • Terminology introduced gradually that reflects current everyday Italian; in some cases new semantic groups are presented with images to facilitate learning • Authentic materials on a range of cultural, literary and everyday themes providing students with the opportunity to enrich and widen their knowledge of Italian society, history and civilisation • A contemporary and attractive format with many photographs Via della Grammatica Via della Grammatica • Keys to the exercises making this grammar book very useful for independent learners • A glossary is available on www.edilingua.it
